instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight but it works in DFU
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid damage.
Got image, but no backlight.

Tested clients screen on know good <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and it is working fine.
Tested J8500 with EDP METER and all diode mode values are correct.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 55V
Tested with known good LCD flex cable and no luck.

When doing "revive device" in DFU I see Apple logo and progress bar but after there is data but no backlight?

Looks like software/firmware?
Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight but it works in DFU
threads.message: Save data (if needed) and try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight but it works in DFU
threads.message:
There was constant errors during DFU restore.

I ref-lashed SoC ROM <CHIP>U4770</CHIP> and restore went without any issues - it is working fine again :)
Thanks
